name: coc-rls
description: Rust language support - code completion, Intellisense, refactoring, reformatting, errors, snippets. A client for the Rust Language Server, built by the RLS team.

rust-client.logToFile.description: When set to true, RLS stderr is logged to a file at workspace root level. Requires reloading extension after change.

rust-client.setLibPath.description: When set to false, environment variable DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH & LD_LIBRARY_PATH are kept for rls.

rust-client.rustupPath.description: Path to rustup executable. Ignored if rustup is disabled.

rust-client.rlsPath.description: Override RLS path. Only required for RLS developers. If you set this and use rustup, you should also set `rust-client.channel` to ensure your RLS sees the right libraries. If you don't use rustup, make sure to set `rust-client.disableRustup`.

rust-client.revealOutputChannelOn.description: Specifies message severity on which the output channel will be revealed. Requires reloading extension after change.

rust-client.updateOnStartup.description: Update the RLS whenever the extension starts up.

rust-client.disableRustup.description: Disable usage of rustup and use rustc/rls from PATH.

rust-client.channel.description: Rust channel to invoke rustup with. Ignored if rustup is disabled. By default, uses the same channel as your currently open project.

rust-client.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the Rust language server.

rust.clear_env_rust_log.description: Clear the RUST_LOG environment variable before running rustc or cargo.

rust.build_lib.description: Specify to run analysis as if running `cargo check --lib`. Use `null` to auto-detect. (unstable)

rust.build_bin.description: Specify to run analysis as if running `cargo check --bin <name>`. Use `null` to auto-detect. (unstable)

rust.wait_to_build.description: Time in milliseconds between receiving a change notification and starting build.

rust.crate_blacklist.description:
Overrides the default list of packages for which analysis is skipped.
Available since RLS 1.38

rust.build_on_save.description: Only index the project when a file is saved and not on change.

rust.features.description: A list of Cargo features to enable.

rust.no_default_features.description: Do not enable default Cargo features.

rust.clippy_preference.description:
Controls eagerness of clippy diagnostics when available. Valid values are (case-insensitive):
 - "off": Disable clippy lints.
 - "opt-in": Clippy lints are shown when crates specify `#![warn(clippy)]`.
 - "on": Clippy lints enabled for all crates in workspace.
You need to install clippy via rustup if you haven't already.

rust.jobs.description: Number of Cargo jobs to be run in parallel.

rust.all_targets.description: Checks the project as if you were running cargo check --all-targets (I.e., check all targets and integration tests too).

rust.target_dir.description: When specified, it places the generated analysis files at the specified target directory. By default it is placed target/rls directory.

rust.rustfmt_path.description: When specified, RLS will use the Rustfmt pointed at the path instead of the bundled one

rust.build_command.description:
EXPERIMENTAL (requires `unstable_features`)
If set, executes a given program responsible for rebuilding save-analysis to be loaded by the RLS. The program given should output a list of resulting .json files on stdout. 
Implies `rust.build_on_save`: true.

rust.full_docs.description: Instructs cargo to enable full documentation extraction during save-analysis while building the crate.

rust.show_hover_context.description: Show additional context in hover tooltips when available. This is often the type local variable declaration.

commands.title: Update the RLS
commands.description: Use Rustup to update Rust, the RLS, and required data

commands.title: Restart the RLS
commands.description: Sometimes, it's just best to try turning it off and on again

author: chemzqm@gmail.com
